text: [Music]
Back in the 70s, you found a snazzy
picture of a wooden shelf that you want
to buy. You cut around it, put it on
your holy scrapbook, and keep it under
your pillow. Fast forward to the '9s.
Internet storms all over the world.
People are scurrying the web and right
clicking is the way to grab a picture of
a wedding gown you always dreamed of.
But then you have to save it. Put it on
a floppy disc and risk to lose it. It's
a new world. There's got to be something
better than this. Use Pinterest. Collect
pictures from any website with your
browser, laptop, tablet, mobile, and
post them on your board. Create as many
boards as you want. Cute animal babies.
delicious looking cookies you just
baked, things your husband really want
for Christmas, or your proud collection
of every Chuck Norris movies, just
anything you can think of. Once pinned,
your pins are shared with other
Penninners who can repin them on their
own boards. You can also follow other
Penninners to get updates on their pins.
It's a fun and simple way to share
things you like and meet others with
similar interest across the globe. It
goes beyond just sharing pictures.
Pinterest can be used to organize
events, share recipes, or do-it-yourself
projects, and promote
stuff. Pinterest. Get your invitation
today and start pinning.
[Music]
